summary: Tokio dependency version 1.23.1 contains a critical soundness vulnerability (CVE WS-2023-0027, CVSS 9.8) in the ReadHalf::unsplit function that can violate Pin contract guarantees under specific conditions. Upgrade to tokio 1.18.5, 1.20.4, or 1.24.2 is required.
userImpact: Applications using tokio 1.23.1 with the io-util feature and !Unpin types in ReadHalf are vulnerable to potential use-after-free exploits.
rootCause: The tokio::io::ReadHalf<T>::unsplit function can violate the Pin contract when used with !Unpin types, allowing unsafe memory operations.
proposedFix: Upgrade tokio to version 1.18.5, 1.20.4, or 1.24.2 or later
resolutionDetails: Issue was automatically closed by Mend after the vulnerable library was either marked as ignored or removed from the project dependency inventory.
keyQuote: A soundness issue was discovered in tokio. tokio::io::ReadHalf<T>::unsplit can violate the Pin contract.
